result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D Valdez

defendant.name: Valdez, Eric D
defendant.address: c/o Jefferson County Jail 411 S. Center St., Jefferson, WI 53549

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:58am 
Defendant Eric D Valdez in court, in custody, with Attorney Francis Raff.  ADA Michael Witt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Valdez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 10:02am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on January 5th at 9:30am
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ae] case called 11:11 AM Defendant Eric D Valdez appeared by phone, in custody from the Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney Francis P Raff in court. ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--not to discuss the case with Victim 1
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:14 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 11/01/22 at 9:30 am

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
